item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Belenenses SAD Logo Os Belenenses – Sociedade Desportiva de Futebol, SAD, also known as B–SAD, is a Portuguese football club from Lisbon founded on 30 June 2018 as an independent entity. A rebel offshoot of Clube de Futebol Os Belenenses, they play in the Primeira Liga. Source
You can download theBelenenseslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Belenenses
item.description: Os Belenenses – Sociedade Desportiva de Futebol, SAD, also known as B–SAD, is a Portuguese football club from Lisbon founded on 30 June 2018 as an independent entity. A rebel offshoot of Clube de Futebol Os Belenenses, they play in the Primeira Liga. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 S.L. Benfica Logo
Sport Lisboa e Benfica, commonly known as Benfica, is a professional football club based in Lisbon, Portugal, that competes in the Primeira Liga, the top flight of Portuguese football. Founded on 28 February 1904 as Sport Lisboa, Benfica is one of the “Big Three” clubs in Portugal that have never been relegated from Primeira Liga, along with rivals Sporting CP and FC Porto. Benfica are nicknamed As Águias, for the symbol atop the club’s crest, and Os Encarnados, for the shirt colour.
You can download theBenficalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Benfica
item.description: Sport Lisboa e Benfica, commonly known as Benfica, is a professional football club based in Lisbon, Portugal, that competes in the Primeira Liga, the top flight of Portuguese football. Founded on 28 February 1904 as Sport Lisboa, Benfica is one of the “Big Three” clubs in Portugal that have never been relegated from Primeira Liga, along with rivals Sporting CP and FC Porto. Benfica are nicknamed As Águias, for the symbol atop the club’s crest, and Os Encarnados, for the shirt colour.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Boavista F.C. Logo
Boavista Futebol Clube, commonly known as Boavista, is a Portuguese sports club from the city of Porto. Founded on 1 August 1903 by British entrepreneurs and Portuguese textile workers, it is one of the oldest clubs in the country and plays in the Primeira Liga, Portuguese football’s top flight. Boavista grew to become an important sports club in Portugal, with sections dedicated to several sports including football, chess, gymnastics, bicycle racing, futsal, volleyball, rink hockey and boxing, among others, with the most notable being the football section with their trademark chequered white and black shirts.
You can download theBoavistalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Boavista
item.description: Boavista Futebol Clube, commonly known as Boavista, is a Portuguese sports club from the city of Porto. Founded on 1 August 1903 by British entrepreneurs and Portuguese textile workers, it is one of the oldest clubs in the country and plays in the Primeira Liga, Portuguese football’s top flight. Boavista grew to become an important sports club in Portugal, with sections dedicated to several sports including football, chess, gymnastics, bicycle racing, futsal, volleyball, rink hockey and boxing, among others, with the most notable being the football section with their trademark chequered white and black shirts.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 S.C. Braga Logo
Sporting Clube de Braga, commonly known as Sporting de Braga or just Braga, is a Portuguese sports club from the city of Braga. Its football team plays in the Primeira Liga at the Estádio Municipal de Braga. Domestically, Braga have won the Taça de Portugal on three occasions, in 1965–66, 2015–16, and in 2020–21, and the Taça da Liga twice in 2012–13 and 2019–20. In the 2000s, Braga became one of Portugal’s most decorated clubs after the Big Three and has had some success in European competitions, winning the last UEFA Intertoto Cup in 2008, and reaching the final of the UEFA Europa League in 2011.
You can download theBragalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Braga
item.description: Sporting Clube de Braga, commonly known as Sporting de Braga or just Braga, is a Portuguese sports club from the city of Braga. Its football team plays in the Primeira Liga at the Estádio Municipal de Braga. Domestically, Braga have won the Taça de Portugal on three occasions, in 1965–66, 2015–16, and in 2020–21, and the Taça da Liga twice in 2012–13 and 2019–20. In the 2000s, Braga became one of Portugal’s most decorated clubs after the Big Three and has had some success in European competitions, winning the last UEFA Intertoto Cup in 2008, and reaching the final of the UEFA Europa League in 2011.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
C.D. Tondela Logo Clube Desportivo de Tondela is a Portuguese professional football club that plays in Primeira Liga, the top flight of Portuguese football. They are based in the town of Tondela, located in Viseu District, and play in the Estádio João Cardoso. Founded in 1933, the club predominantly played within Portugal’s regional leagues until their climb up the league pyramid after 2004. Source
You can download theCDTlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: CDT
item.description: Clube Desportivo de Tondela is a Portuguese professional football club that plays in Primeira Liga, the top flight of Portuguese football. They are based in the town of Tondela, located in Viseu District, and play in the Estádio João Cardoso. Founded in 1933, the club predominantly played within Portugal’s regional leagues until their climb up the league pyramid after 2004. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 G.D. Estoril Praia Logo
Grupo Desportivo Estoril Praia, commonly known as Estoril, is a Portuguese sports club from Estoril, Cascais, Lisbon. Founded on 17 May 1939, its football team currently plays in Primeira Liga and hold home games at the Estádio António Coimbra da Mota, with a seating capacity of 8,015. As a sports club, Estoril has departments for football, futsal and basketball. Since the club’s establishment, the senior football team has won nine secondary trophies, with the most recent being the 2011–12 Liga de Honra.
You can download theEstorillogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Estoril
item.description: Grupo Desportivo Estoril Praia, commonly known as Estoril, is a Portuguese sports club from Estoril, Cascais, Lisbon. Founded on 17 May 1939, its football team currently plays in Primeira Liga and hold home games at the Estádio António Coimbra da Mota, with a seating capacity of 8,015. As a sports club, Estoril has departments for football, futsal and basketball. Since the club’s establishment, the senior football team has won nine secondary trophies, with the most recent being the 2011–12 Liga de Honra.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 F.C. Famalicão Logo
Futebol Clube de Famalicão, commonly known as Famalicão, is a Portuguese football club from Vila Nova de Famalicão. Founded on 21 August 1931, its senior team currently plays in the Primeira Liga, the top tier of Portuguese football. Since 1952, Famalicão have played their home matches at the Estádio Municipal 22 de Junho, which holds a 5,307-seat capacity. The Famalicenses' most successful period of their history occurred in the early 1990s, where the club played four seasons in the Primeira Liga, between 1990 and 1994, counting now with seven Primeira Liga appearances.
You can download theFamalicaologo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Famalicao
item.description: Futebol Clube de Famalicão, commonly known as Famalicão, is a Portuguese football club from Vila Nova de Famalicão. Founded on 21 August 1931, its senior team currently plays in the Primeira Liga, the top tier of Portuguese football. Since 1952, Famalicão have played their home matches at the Estádio Municipal 22 de Junho, which holds a 5,307-seat capacity. The Famalicenses' most successful period of their history occurred in the early 1990s, where the club played four seasons in the Primeira Liga, between 1990 and 1994, counting now with seven Primeira Liga appearances.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 C.S. Marítimo Logo
Club Sport Marítimo MH M, commonly known as Marítimo, is a Portuguese sports club founded in Funchal, Madeira, in 1910. Marítimo is best known for its football team playing in Portugal’s top-flight competition, the Primeira Liga. The club’s reserve team, Marítimo B, compete in the fourth division, and the female team feature in the top-tier Campeonato Nacional Feminino. Aside from football, Marítimo have teams in other sports competing in national leagues, such as volleyball, handball, roller hockey and athletics.
You can download theMaritimologo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Maritimo
item.description: Club Sport Marítimo MH M, commonly known as Marítimo, is a Portuguese sports club founded in Funchal, Madeira, in 1910. Marítimo is best known for its football team playing in Portugal’s top-flight competition, the Primeira Liga. The club’s reserve team, Marítimo B, compete in the fourth division, and the female team feature in the top-tier Campeonato Nacional Feminino. Aside from football, Marítimo have teams in other sports competing in national leagues, such as volleyball, handball, roller hockey and athletics.

Moreirense F.C. Logo Moreirense Futebol Clube is a Portuguese professional football club based in Moreira de Cónegos, Guimarães Municipality, in Minho. Founded on 1 November 1938, it plays in the Primeira Liga, holding home games at Parque de Jogos Comendador Joaquim de Almeida Freitas, with a capacity for 9,000 spectators. Source
You can download theMoreirenselogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 C.D. Nacional Logo
Clube Desportivo Nacional, commonly known as Nacional and sometimes Nacional da Madeira, is a Portuguese football club based in Funchal, on the island of Madeira. Founded on 8 December 1910, it currently plays in the Liga Portugal 2, Portugal’s second-tier division of professional football. It plays its home games at Estádio da Madeira, also known as Estádio da Choupana. Built in 1998 and named at the time Estádio Eng. Rui Alves after the current club president Rui Alves, it seats approximately 5,132 people.
You can download theNacionallogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Nacional
item.description: Clube Desportivo Nacional, commonly known as Nacional and sometimes Nacional da Madeira, is a Portuguese football club based in Funchal, on the island of Madeira. Founded on 8 December 1910, it currently plays in the Liga Portugal 2, Portugal’s second-tier division of professional football. It plays its home games at Estádio da Madeira, also known as Estádio da Choupana. Built in 1998 and named at the time Estádio Eng. Rui Alves after the current club president Rui Alves, it seats approximately 5,132 people.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 F.C. Paços de Ferreira Logo
Futebol Clube Paços de Ferreira is a Portuguese football club based in Paços de Ferreira, Porto district. Founded in 1950, the club competes in the Primeira Liga, holding home games at the 9,077-seater Estádio da Mata Real, a municipal stadium where the team has been based since 1973. The club’s colours are yellow and green. Paços de Ferreira is one of the most historic teams in Portuguese football, having been in the Portuguese Primeira Liga for 20 seasons.
You can download thePacos de Ferreiralogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Pacos de Ferreira
item.description: Futebol Clube Paços de Ferreira is a Portuguese football club based in Paços de Ferreira, Porto district. Founded in 1950, the club competes in the Primeira Liga, holding home games at the 9,077-seater Estádio da Mata Real, a municipal stadium where the team has been based since 1973. The club’s colours are yellow and green. Paços de Ferreira is one of the most historic teams in Portuguese football, having been in the Portuguese Primeira Liga for 20 seasons.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Portimonense S.C. Logo
Portimonense Sporting Clube is a Portuguese sports club based in Portimão. Founded on 14 August 1914, it is most notable for its professional football team, which currently plays in the Primeira Liga, the top flight of Portuguese football. It also fields various youth teams and a veterans team in football, as well as teams in basketball. Located in Algarve’s second largest city, its stadium, the Estádio Municipal de Portimão, has a capacity of 9,544 spectators after undergoing renovation in early 2011.
You can download thePortimonenselogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Portimonense
item.description: Portimonense Sporting Clube is a Portuguese sports club based in Portimão. Founded on 14 August 1914, it is most notable for its professional football team, which currently plays in the Primeira Liga, the top flight of Portuguese football. It also fields various youth teams and a veterans team in football, as well as teams in basketball. Located in Algarve’s second largest city, its stadium, the Estádio Municipal de Portimão, has a capacity of 9,544 spectators after undergoing renovation in early 2011.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 C.D. Santa Clara Logo
Clube Desportivo Santa Clara is a Portuguese football club from Ponta Delgada, Azores. They play in the 13,277-seat Estádio de São Miguel. They are the most successful football team from the Azores Islands as the only team from the archipelago to compete in a UEFA competition, having qualified for the UEFA Intertoto Cup and the UEFA Europa Conference League. To date, Santa Clara is the only club from the Azores islands to have competed in the top division of the Portuguese Liga, being thus the westernmost top-flight club in Europe.
You can download theSanta Claralogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Santa Clara
item.description: Clube Desportivo Santa Clara is a Portuguese football club from Ponta Delgada, Azores. They play in the 13,277-seat Estádio de São Miguel. They are the most successful football team from the Azores Islands as the only team from the archipelago to compete in a UEFA competition, having qualified for the UEFA Intertoto Cup and the UEFA Europa Conference League. To date, Santa Clara is the only club from the Azores islands to have competed in the top division of the Portuguese Liga, being thus the westernmost top-flight club in Europe.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Sporting CP Logo
Sporting Clube de Portugal ComC MHIH OM, otherwise known simply as Sporting, as Sporting CP, or often as Sporting Lisbon abroad, is a club based in Lisbon. Founded on 1 July 1906, Sporting is one of the “Três Grandes” football clubs in Portugal, along with rivals S.L. Benfica and FC Porto, that have never been relegated from the top flight of Portuguese football, Primeira Liga, since 1934. Sporting are nicknamed Leões and Verde e Brancos.
You can download theSportinglogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

item.description: Sporting Clube de Portugal ComC MHIH OM, otherwise known simply as Sporting, as Sporting CP, or often as Sporting Lisbon abroad, is a club based in Lisbon. Founded on 1 July 1906, Sporting is one of the “Três Grandes” football clubs in Portugal, along with rivals S.L. Benfica and FC Porto, that have never been relegated from the top flight of Portuguese football, Primeira Liga, since 1934. Sporting are nicknamed Leões and Verde e Brancos.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
U.D. Vilafranquense Logo União Desportiva Vilafranquense is a Portuguese football club from Vila Franca de Xira, Lisbon District. It currently plays in the Liga Portugal 2, the second tier of the Portuguese football league system, following its promotion in 2019. The other only time when the club had played in the second tier was in 1987–88 season, when that level was still regionalised. Source
You can download theUDVlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

It currently plays in the Liga Portugal 2, the second tier of the Portuguese football league system, following its promotion in 2019. The other only time when the club had played in the second tier was in 1987–88 season, when that level was still regionalised. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Vitória de Guimarães Logo
Vitória Sport Clube, commonly known as Vitória de Guimarães, is a Portuguese professional football club based in Guimarães that competes in the Primeira Liga, the top-flight of football in Portugal. Vitória de Guimarães have finished third in the Primeira Liga on four occasions, most recently in 2007–08. They have won one Taça de Portugal and one Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira, while also being runners-up of the former on six occasions.
You can download theVitoria de Guimaraeslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Vitoria de Guimaraes
item.description: Vitória Sport Clube, commonly known as Vitória de Guimarães, is a Portuguese professional football club based in Guimarães that competes in the Primeira Liga, the top-flight of football in Portugal. Vitória de Guimarães have finished third in the Primeira Liga on four occasions, most recently in 2007–08. They have won one Taça de Portugal and one Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira, while also being runners-up of the former on six occasions.

F.C. Vizela Logo Futebol Clube de Vizela is a Portuguese football club based in Vizela, Braga District. Founded in 1939, it currently plays in the Liga Portugal Bwin, holding home games at the Estádio do Futebol Clube de Vizela, with a capacity for 6,100 spectators. Source
You can download theVizelalogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Vizela

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Jerónimo Martins Logo
Jerónimo Martins SGPS, SA Sociedade Aberta is a Portuguese corporate group that operates in food distribution and specialised retail. It operates more than 4,400 stores in Portugal, Poland, and Colombia. The group is the majority owner of Jerónimo Martins Retail, which operates the Pingo Doce super- and hypermarket chain in Portugal. JMR has been run as a 51%-49% joint venture with the Dutch firm Ahold Delhaize since 1982. Jerónimo Martins is listed on Euronext Lisbon, under the code JMT, and is part of the PSI-20 index.
You can download theJeronimo Martinslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Jeronimo Martins
item.description: Jerónimo Martins SGPS, SA Sociedade Aberta is a Portuguese corporate group that operates in food distribution and specialised retail. It operates more than 4,400 stores in Portugal, Poland, and Colombia. The group is the majority owner of Jerónimo Martins Retail, which operates the Pingo Doce super- and hypermarket chain in Portugal. JMR has been run as a 51%-49% joint venture with the Dutch firm Ahold Delhaize since 1982. Jerónimo Martins is listed on Euronext Lisbon, under the code JMT, and is part of the PSI-20 index.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 2004 UEFA European Football Championship Logo
The 2004 UEFA European Football Championship, commonly referred to as Euro 2004, was the 12th edition of the UEFA European Championship, a quadrennial football competition contested by the men’s national teams of UEFA member associations. The final tournament was hosted for the first time in Portugal, from 12 June to 4 July 2004. A total of 31 matches were played in ten venues across eight cities – Aveiro, Braga, Coimbra, Guimarães, Faro/Loulé, Leiria, Lisbon, and Porto.
You can download theUEFA Euro 2004logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: UEFA Euro 2004
item.description: The 2004 UEFA European Football Championship, commonly referred to as Euro 2004, was the 12th edition of the UEFA European Championship, a quadrennial football competition contested by the men’s national teams of UEFA member associations. The final tournament was hosted for the first time in Portugal, from 12 June to 4 July 2004. A total of 31 matches were played in ten venues across eight cities – Aveiro, Braga, Coimbra, Guimarães, Faro/Loulé, Leiria, Lisbon, and Porto.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 FC Porto Logo
Futebol Clube do Porto, MHIH, OM, commonly known as FC Porto or simply Porto, is a Portuguese professional sports club based in Porto. It is best known for the professional football team playing in the Primeira Liga, the top flight of Portuguese football. Founded on 28 September 1893, Porto is one of the “Big Three” teams in Portugal – together with Lisbon-based rivals Benfica and Sporting CP, that have appeared in every season of the Primeira Liga since its establishment in 1934.
You can download thePortologo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Porto
item.description: Futebol Clube do Porto, MHIH, OM, commonly known as FC Porto or simply Porto, is a Portuguese professional sports club based in Porto. It is best known for the professional football team playing in the Primeira Liga, the top flight of Portuguese football. Founded on 28 September 1893, Porto is one of the “Big Three” teams in Portugal – together with Lisbon-based rivals Benfica and Sporting CP, that have appeared in every season of the Primeira Liga since its establishment in 1934.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
AJP Motos Logo AJP Motos is a Portuguese manufacturer of enduro and off-road motorcycles using single-cylinder 4-stroke engines of 125cc, 200cc, 240cc, 250cc and 650cc capacity. The brand name “AJP” is derived from the initials of seven-times Portuguese Enduro Champion António J Pinto. Source
You can download theAJP Motoslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

UMM Logo UMM is a Portuguese metal works factory and ex-automobile manufacturer based in Lisbon, Portugal. It was founded in 1977 with the purpose of manufacturing four-wheel drive vehicles for agricultural, industrial and utility applications. Source
You can download theUMMlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Air Luxor Logo Air Luxor was an airline based in Luxor Plaza in Lisbon, Portugal, operating a limited number of scheduled flights out of Portela Airport, Lisbon. The airline’s operations were located in Building C1 and Hangar 7 in Delta Park, an area in Lisbon Airport. Source
You can download theAir Luxorlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Oceano Azul Foundation Logo
The Oceano Azul Foundation is an international organization founded by the Sociedade Francisco Manuel dos Santos and based in Portugal with the mission of contributing to the sustainability of a healthy and productive ocean. Combining scientific study, political and economic activism, together with a deep ethical commitment, the Foundation integrates many human perspectives to “look at the planet’s sustainability from the ocean’s point of view.” The Oceano Azul Foundation manages the Oceanário de Lisboa, for which Chermayeff & Geismar & Haviv designed the visual identity, as well as major tile murals.
You can download theOceano Azul Foundationlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Oceano Azul Foundation
item.description: The Oceano Azul Foundation is an international organization founded by the Sociedade Francisco Manuel dos Santos and based in Portugal with the mission of contributing to the sustainability of a healthy and productive ocean. Combining scientific study, political and economic activism, together with a deep ethical commitment, the Foundation integrates many human perspectives to “look at the planet’s sustainability from the ocean’s point of view.” The Oceano Azul Foundation manages the Oceanário de Lisboa, for which Chermayeff & Geismar & Haviv designed the visual identity, as well as major tile murals.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 TAP Air Portugal Logo
TAP Air Portugal is the flag carrier airline of Portugal, headquartered at Lisbon Airport which also serves as its hub. TAP – Transportes Aéreos Portugueses – has been a member of the Star Alliance since 2005 and operates on average 2,500 flights a week to 87 destinations in 34 countries worldwide. The company has a fleet of 90 airplanes, 68 of which were manufactured by Airbus and the remaining 22 by Embraer and ATR, operating on behalf of the regional airline TAP Express.
You can download theTAPlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: TAP
item.description: TAP Air Portugal is the flag carrier airline of Portugal, headquartered at Lisbon Airport which also serves as its hub. TAP – Transportes Aéreos Portugueses – has been a member of the Star Alliance since 2005 and operates on average 2,500 flights a week to 87 destinations in 34 countries worldwide. The company has a fleet of 90 airplanes, 68 of which were manufactured by Airbus and the remaining 22 by Embraer and ATR, operating on behalf of the regional airline TAP Express.
